config.description: MPLS global configuration

local-packet-handling.description: Use this attribute to enable the labeling of locally generated TCP packets. All other locally generated packets are not looked at by the MPLS Forwarder

lsp-stitching.description: Use this attribute to enable lsp stitching for ILM and installed FTM

propagate-ttl.description: Use this attribute to enable TTL propagation. Enabling TTL propagation causes the TTL value in the IP header to be copied onto the TTL field in the shim header, at the LSP ingress

ingress-ttl-value.description: Use this attribute to set a Time to Live (TTL) value for LSPs for which this LSR is the ingress.

egress-ttl-value.description: mpls egress-ttl . Use this attribute to set a custom Time to Live (TTL) value for LSPs for which this LSR is the egress

lsp-model-uniform.description: Use this attribute to configure the MPLS LSP model as Uniform.

lsp-stitching.description: Use this attribute to enable lsp stitching for ILM and installed FTM

propagate-ttl.description: Use this attribute to enable TTL propagation. Enabling TTL propagation causes the TTL value in the IP header to be copied onto the TTL field in the shim header, at the LSP ingress

ingress-ttl-value.description: Use this attribute to set a Time to Live (TTL) value for LSPs for which this LSR is the ingress.

egress-ttl-value.description: mpls egress-ttl . Use this attribute to set a custom Time to Live (TTL) value for LSPs for which this LSR is the egress

interfaces.description: mpls interface level configuration and state data

interface.description: List of MPLS enabled interfaces on the device.

name.description: The textual name of the interface.

config.description: Interface configuration

name.description: The textual name of the interface.

config.description: Label switching configuration

enable.description: Use this attribute to enable label-switching on a TE link

label-space.description: Use this attribute to specify label-space for the interface, at present only label space 0 is supported

state.description: Operational state for Label switching configuration

enable.description: Use this attribute to enable label-switching on a TE link

label-space.description: Use this attribute to specify label-space for the interface, at present only label space 0 is supported

config.description: Configurations for MPLS Interface Bandwidth

admin-group-name.description: Use this attribute to create an administrative group to be used for links. Each link can be a member of one or more, or no administrative groups.this attribute adds link between an interface and a group. The name is the name of the group previously configured. There can be multiple groups per interface.

shared-risk-link-group.description: Use this attribute to add the link to a srlg group

bandwidth.description: Use this attribute to specify a discrete, maximum bandwidth value for the interface. The bandwidth attribute takes input ranges from 1 to 999 kbps, 1 to 999 mbps and 1 to 100 gbps.

reservable-bandwidth.description: Use this attribute to specify the maximum reservable bandwidth per interface. This value can be equal or smaller value than max-bandwidth. Attribute takes input from 1 to 999 kbps, 1 to 999 mbps and 1 to 100 gbps

uni-available-bandwidth.description: Use this attribute to specify a unidirectional, available bandwidth value for the interface. The bandwidth attribute takes input in 0-999 kbps, 0-999 mbps and 0-100 gbps.

uni-residual-bandwidth.description: Use this attribute to specify a unidirectional, residual bandwidth value for the interface. The bandwidth attribute takes input in 0-999 kbps, 0-999 mbps and 0-100 gbps.

uni-utilized-bandwidth.description: Use this attribute to specify a unidirectional, utilised bandwidth value for the interface. The bandwidth attribute takes input in 0 to 999 kbps, 0 to 999 mbps and 1 to 100gbps.

config.description: Config Container for MPLS ILM POP Entries

enable-pop-label.description: Use this attribute to create an ILM entry in the ILM table to which a POP incoming interface is bound. Upon receipt of a labeled packet on an MPLS-enabled router, a lookup is done based on the incoming label in the ILM table. If a match is found, the packet may either be label-switched downstream, or popped and passed over IP. In a pop operation, an outgoing label is not needed as is either accepted or forwarded over IP. The nexthop option is also not mandatory because the FEC IP address could be a local IP address

state.description: State Container for MPLS ILM POP Entries

enable-pop-label.description: Use this attribute to create an ILM entry in the ILM table to which a POP incoming interface is bound. Upon receipt of a labeled packet on an MPLS-enabled router, a lookup is done based on the incoming label in the ILM table. If a match is found, the packet may either be label-switched downstream, or popped and passed over IP. In a pop operation, an outgoing label is not needed as is either accepted or forwarded over IP. The nexthop option is also not mandatory because the FEC IP address could be a local IP address
